way at Hopkins. For years undergraduates called for

but that no satisfactory means were available for
judging teaching ability other than the Course Guide
evaluation.

formula for teacher evaluation drawn up by a Council
sub-committee. This plan sould not be underestimated
in its significance. The SC subcommittee
recomendations embody a set of criteria, developed by
undergraduates, which surpass the feeble popularity
judgements serving as the bases of the Course Guide
criteria. New input on teacher criteria by
undergraduates is not only necessary but will also be
well received by the Academic Council. Hopefully the
Student Council will have enough wisdom to adopt
this plan which has the potential to provide Hopkins
with a satisfactory means of evaluating teacher ability.
